48223-d-04-19-83-RFP.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 7:20 A.M. ON APRIL 19, 1983, THE CREW OF RF&P TRAIN 290, WITH 105 CARS, WAS IN THEPROCESS OF YARDING THEIR TRAIN THE NORTHBOUND RECEIVING YAR. OF THE 105 CARS, 88 CARS WERE YARDED ONTRACK 9 AND THE OVERFLOW OF 17 CARS WERE SET OVER TRACK 11. WHILE CONSUMATING THE SET-OVER, THE LEAD MOTOR (NO. 124) HEADED INTO THE 25-50 MASTER RETARDER (INSTEAD OF MOVING INTO THE EAST INCLINE TRACK) UPON INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE YARDMASTER ON DUTY. AS A RESULT, THE MOVEMENT OF THE MOTOR CRUSHED AND DESTROYED THE RADAR CONTROL UNIT IN THE RETARDER. THE MOTOR ALSO INCURRED CNSIDERABLE DAMAGE. SINCE CURRENT INSTRUCTIONS PROHIBIT THE MOVEMENT OF ROADE ENGINES THROUGH THE GROUP RETARDERS ON THE NORTHBOUND HUMP, THE YARDMASTER WAS CHARGED WITH VIOLATION OF THOSE INSTRUCTIONS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
